plugins.name: Chartify
plugins.description:
Chartify is a powerful yet simple plugin that helps you turn spreadsheet data into clean, customizable charts ‚Äî directly in Figma.


Just upload a file or paste a public Google Sheets link, and Chartify will generate a beautiful chart that fits right into your design.


What Chartify can do:

  1. Supports data from:
  2. CSV, TSV, Excel (.xlsx/.xls)
  3. Google Sheets (public links)
  4. HTML tables, XML, Word (.docx), PDF, and more
  5. 6 chart types:
  6. Line
  7. Smooth Line
  8. Column
  9. Bar
  10. Pie
  11. Donut
  12. Smart customization options:
  13. Auto layout support
  14. Figma Variables for styles
  15. Optional axes, grid, and legends
  16. Responsive and consistent with your design system



How to use:

  1. Open the plugin.
  2. Upload a data file or paste a public Google Sheets URL.
  3. (Optional) Enter the sheet name.
  4. Choose the chart type.
  5. Adjust settings: auto layout, variables, axes, and legend.
  6. Click Generate ‚Äî your chart will appear directly on the canvas.


Chartify is built for designers who need to visualize data fast ‚Äî without leaving Figma.

accepted.name: Andrei Kuznetsov
accepted.description: Templates, UI Kits, Design Systems, Plugins

plugins.tagline: Effortless Data Charts in Figma

plugins.name: TokenWizard
plugins.description:
TokenWizard is your all-in-one starter tool for building consistent, scalable design systems in Figma. With just one click, it generates structured design tokens as Figma variables, creates corresponding color, text, and spacing styles, and even renders a beautiful visual palette preview right on your canvas.


Whether you're building a brand system from scratch or bringing order to design chaos, TokenWizard adapts to your needs. Choose which token types to include (Color, Spacing, Typography), pick base colors from the UI, and skip the hassle of manual setup. No duplicate styles, no redundant variables ‚Äî everything is smartly created or updated in-place.


Designed for UX teams, solo designers, and developers alike, TokenWizard transforms repetitive setup into a streamlined, creative experience ‚Äî so you can start designing with structure in minutes, not hours.

accepted.description: Google Certified UX/UI & Product Designer with 12+ years of experience designing user-friendly interfaces.

plugins.name: Design2Dev
plugins.description:
Design2Dev is a Figma plugin that extracts detailed design specs and generates structured AI prompts for React Native. Map custom UIs to design systems, export specs as JSON, and get production-ready code from ChatGPT, Claude, or Cursor ‚Äî no guesswork, just clarity.


Description:

Design2Dev bridges the gap between your polished Figma designs and AI-generated React‚ÄØNative code. No more guess-and-check with plain-language prompts‚Äîthis plugin produces developer-grade output in seconds:


  1. Extract design specs ‚Äì Build a full JSON mapping of component hierarchy, styles (colours, typography, spacing), layout properties, and design tokens.
  2. Map to UI libraries ‚Äì Auto-align designs with React Native Paper or other design systems.
  3. Generate AI prompts ‚Äì Output prompt-ready TXT files formatted to work effortlessly with ChatGPT, Claude, Cursor, Gemini, etc.
  4. Export visuals and specs ‚Äì Export PNG snapshots of selected frames, and JSON + TXT bundles‚Äîready for automated workflows or human inspection.
  5. Designed for speed ‚Äì Perfect for solo designers/devs needing accurate code now, not later. No least-common-denominator outputs‚Äîjust intention-preserving handoffs.


Ideal For:

  1. Designers shipping React Native apps today
  2. Developers optimizing prompt engineering from visuals
  3. Teams wanting clean spec-to-code pipelines before Figma or Bolt catch up
plugins.tagline: Turn Figma Designs into AI-Ready Code Prompts. Instantly.

plugins.name: Flow Linker
plugins.description:
In large-scale design projects, prototyping every screen-to-screen interaction isn‚Äôt always practical. With dozens or even hundreds of screens, building interactive flows becomes time-consuming and sometimes infeasible, especially when deadlines are tight or priorities shift.


Yet developers and stakeholders still need clarity. They rely on understanding how different screens connect, what the logical flow of a user journey looks like, and where transitions happen even without full prototypes.


That‚Äôs where Flow Link comes in.


Rather than investing hours in building out detailed prototypes, Flow Link lets you visually map out interactions using clean, orthogonal connectors. These lines don‚Äôt just show flow‚Äîthey‚Äôre configurable, styled, navigable, and reusable. And with frame linking, viewers can even jump directly to connected screens, making your Figma file interactive in structure, even without full prototyping.


Flow Link fills the gap between rapid design iteration and clear developer handoff making complex projects more navigable, understandable, and scalable.
plugins.tagline: Your Figma Flow, Made Effortless.

plugins.name: Iconize
plugins.description:
Transform any Figma design into a complete set of perfectly scaled Chrome extension icons in seconds.


Benefits:

  1. Save hours of manual work - No more tedious resizing and exporting
  2. Perfect proportions - Maintains design integrity across all sizes
  3. Professional results - Vector paths, text, and effects scale beautifully
  4. Chrome extension ready - Standard sizes (16px, 24px, 36px, 48px, 128px)
  5. Batch processing - Handle multiple designs simultaneously


How to use:

  1. Select your design - Choose any frame, group, component, or instance
  2. Run Iconize - Go to Plugins ‚Üí Iconize ‚Üí Scale to Icon Sizes
  3. Get your icons - Five perfectly scaled versions appear instantly
  4. Export to PNG / SVG and use - Icons are named icon16, icon24, icon36, icon48, icon128


Perfect for Chrome extensions, web apps, mobile apps, and any project requiring multiple icon sizes. Works with complex designs including vectors, text, effects, and nested elements.

plugins.name: Radix color palette
plugins.description:
Step 1: Enter a base color in the Accent section to generate a palette.

Step 2: Copy the accent scale generated below.

Step 3: Copy the CSS code from:

.root, .light, .light-theme { ... }

Step 4: Repeat Steps 1‚Äì3 for the Dark Theme.

Step 5: Create a collection in Figma with two modes named exactly: Light Mode, Dark Mode (Case-sensitive)

Step 6: Paste the Light and Dark theme CSS into their respective input fields in the plugin.

Step 7: Click the "Create Variables" button.

Step 8: Edit variable names as needed in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Copy Radix CSS code and paste it here to instantly add your custom palette variables to the file.

plugins.name: BrowserLens
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you import color styles from the BrowserLens web extension. Insert colors as layers in your design and add palettes to your local styles.


Learn more about BrowserLens: https://browserlens.com/

Documentation: https://docs.browserlens.com/


How to Use

  1. Open any webpage with the BrowserLens extension.
  2. Click export > Figma (BrowserLens Plugin).
  3. Download the style file for Figma.
  4. Run this plugin and upload the style file.
  5. Choose whether to add colors as local styles.
  6. Click 'Import Styles'.


About BrowserLens


BrowserLens is a web extension designed to extract styling and seo information from any webpage without the need for developer tools. It provides a simple UI for extracting and copying webpage information from the current tab.


Extension Features

  1. ‚å®Ô∏è View fonts used on a webpage and the associated CSS values.
  2. üñåÔ∏è Extract colors from a webpage and click to copy color value.
  3. üåÖ Extract gradients from a webpage and click to copy CSS value.
  4. üé® Export color palettes to Figma.
  5. üåê Preview SEO data including page meta, OpenGraph tags and Twitter Card data.
  6. ‚úÖ Check SEO meta for best practices including title and description length.
  7. üñºÔ∏è List all images present on a page and click to download, including background images.
  8. üåÉ Dark mode support.

plugins.name: Zeytal Variables Extractor
plugins.description:
Zeytal helps developers extract and optimize SVGs, transform Figma styles and variables, and generate TailwindCSS config files effortlessly.


This plugin helps Zeytal users leverage their Figma variables.


Zeytal Features

  1. Extract and optimize SVGs
  2. Extract and convert Figma variables to .ts, .js, .json, .css, .scss, .sass, and .less files
  3. Extract and convert Figma styles to .ts, .js, .json, .css, .scss, .sass, and .less files
  4. Convert Figma styles and variables to TailwindCSS v4 config files.


This Plugin

This plugin helps Figma users prepare their Figma files for Figma variables extraction and code generation.


How it works :

  1. Start the plugin.
  2. Click on one button to export your Figma variables to Zeytal
  3. Use Zeytal CLI to generate your code and config files


Everything is explained in detail in Zeytal documentation.

plugins.name: Badenova Design System Sync
plugins.description:
This plugin synchronizes your Figma tokens with the Badenova Design System


Usage:

You need to provide a valid GitHub token to synchronize your Figma tokens.

To obtain a GitHub token, contact christoph.hummel@badenova.de or generate your own token.


If you have a valid GitHub token, enter it into the respective input field and press Save.

Then, click the Sync Badenova Design-Tokens button.

If the synchronization is successful, you will receive a confirmation message.

  3. The plugin will generate an SVG vector output placed adjacent to the original image node.


Notes

plugins.name: ‰∏ÄÈîÆÁøªËØëÂÖÉÁ¥† Quick Translate
plugins.description:
Introduction

Quick Translate is a Figma plugin designed to help you instantly translate selected text elements into different languages with just one click. Save time and improve your workflow by translating text directly within your design files.


Function Description

  1. Translate selected text elements into a specified target language.
  2. Supports multiple languages and automatic translation of all text layers in a Figma selection.
  3. Easy-to-use interface to select languages and apply translations quickly.
  4. Ideal for designers working on multilingual projects or collaborating with global teams.


How to Use

  1. Select one or more text elements in your Figma file.
  2. Open the plugin from the "Plugins" menu.
  3. Choose the target language for translation.
  4. Click the "Translate" button, and the selected text will be replaced with the translated version.


Notes

  1. Ensure your Figma selection includes text elements, as the plugin only works with text layers.
  2. The translation may vary depending on the accuracy of the API and the language selected.
  3. For optimal results, select only relevant text elements to avoid unnecessary API calls.

137614.name: ‰∏ÄÈîÆÁøªËØëÂÖÉÁ¥† Quick Translate
137614.description:
Introduction

Quick Translate is a Figma plugin designed to help you instantly translate selected text elements into different languages with just one click. Save time and improve your workflow by translating text directly within your design files.


Function Description

  1. Translate selected text elements into a specified target language.
  2. Supports multiple languages and automatic translation of all text layers in a Figma selection.
  3. Easy-to-use interface to select languages and apply translations quickly.
  4. Ideal for designers working on multilingual projects or collaborating with global teams.


How to Use

  1. Select one or more text elements in your Figma file.
  2. Open the plugin from the "Plugins" menu.
  3. Choose the target language for translation.
  4. Click the "Translate" button, and the selected text will be replaced with the translated version.


Notes

  1. Ensure your Figma selection includes text elements, as the plugin only works with text layers.
  2. The translation may vary depending on the accuracy of the API and the language selected.
  3. For optimal results, select only relevant text elements to avoid unnecessary API calls.

plugins.description:
Introduction

This plugin is designed to help users export detailed JSON data of selected nodes, including auto layout information, Frame nesting relationships, text properties, and more. With this plugin, users can easily retrieve structured data from design elements, facilitating data analysis, secondary development, or documentation.


ÂäüËÉΩ

  1. Export complete JSON data of selected nodes, including properties like type, name, size, position, fills, strokes, and more.
  2. Support exporting text content, font name, font size, and other properties of text nodes.
  3. Support nested export of nodes such as Frame, Group, Component, and Instance, preserving the full hierarchical structure.
  4. Complete export of auto layout information, including layout mode, primary and secondary axis alignment, padding, and spacing.
  5. Safely serialized JSON data export ensures compatibility and completeness.


Usage Instructions

  1. Select one or more nodes from which you want to export data.
  2. Click the export button in the plugin, and the plugin will automatically extract all relevant information from the selected nodes and generate JSON data.
  3. The exported JSON data will be displayed in the plugin interface, allowing users to copy or download it for further use.


Notes

  1. This plugin currently supports exporting properties of common node types such as Frame.
  2. Ensure that the selected node types are supported by the plugin; otherwise, related data might not be exportable.
  3. If errors occur during the export process, check whether the nodes contain excessive nesting or complex properties. Simplify the structure if needed and try again.

plugins.name: Controlled Chaos Generator
plugins.description:
Controlled Chaos is a creative plugin for Figma that lets you generate multiple layout variations from a single frame using randomized component variants and layout rules.


Ideal for generative design workflows, creative exploration, and visual prototyping, the plugin allows you to:


Randomize Variants and Modes within a component set


Generate layout variations based on predefined rules


Choose your level of chaos, from subtle to extreme


Preserve your original design by generating new instances


Whether you're designing posters, exploring compositions, or creating a system for generative art, Controlled Chaos gives you the power to balance consistency with surprise.


How to use it

Select a frame that contains components with variants (e.g. posters, cards, layouts‚Ä¶).


In the plugin UI, choose your Chaos Level:

Low: subtle and controlled changes

Medium: a balance between order and randomness

High: full chaos, maximum variation


(Optional) Enable Layout Chaos to also randomize the size and layout properties of elements.


Click ‚ÄúGenerate chaos‚Äù. The plugin will create a duplicate of your selected frame, with randomized variants and layout ‚Äî your original design stays untouched.

plugins.name: webpix
